## Problem Statement {background-color="#0f172a"}

<br>

**What:** Predict eviction filing counts by census tract

<br>

**Why it matters:**

-   Philadelphia has **\~18,000 eviction filings/year** (Top 10 nationally)
-   Evictions disproportionately impact **Black and low-income renters**
-   Current response is **reactive** â€” interventions come too late

<br>

[**Goal:** Enable proactive resource deployment before eviction spikes occur]{style="color: #f472b6; font-size: 1.1em;"}

## Results {background-color="#0f172a"}

```{r}
#| fig-width: 10
#| fig-height: 4
#| fig-align: center

tibble(
  variable = c("Rent Burden", "% Renter", "Unemployment", "Income", "POI Density"),
  estimate = c(0.045, 0.032, 0.028, -0.025, -0.015),
  se = c(0.008, 0.006, 0.007, 0.006, 0.004)
) %>%
  mutate(
    lower = estimate - 1.96 * se,
    upper = estimate + 1.96 * se,
    direction = ifelse(estimate > 0, "â†‘ Risk", "â†“ Risk")
  ) %>%
  ggplot(aes(x = estimate, y = reorder(variable, estimate), color = direction)) +
  geom_vline(xintercept = 0, linetype = "dashed", color = "#475569") +
  geom_errorbarh(aes(xmin = lower, xmax = upper), height = 0.2, linewidth = 1.2) +
  geom_point(size = 5) +
  scale_color_manual(values = c("â†‘ Risk" = "#f472b6", "â†“ Risk" = "#4ade80")) +
  labs(x = "Effect on Log(Eviction Count)", y = NULL, color = NULL) +
  theme_dark_minimal()
```

## Limitations & Bias {background-color="#0f172a"}

<br>

**Data Limitations**

-   Only captures **formal filings** â€” misses informal displacement
-   2â€“3 week **data lag** limits real-time prediction
-   Census data is **1â€“2 years old**

<br>

**Potential Harms**

-   Could **stigmatize** already-marginalized neighborhoods
-   Risk of **self-fulfilling prophecy** if landlords use predictions
-   Benefits may not reach those **most vulnerable**
